paragraph.bold: This screen is used for Chart of Accounts entry and maintenance.

ClassHelp.paragraph: The only information that is required for an account is a description.
You can also enter:

item-list.item: An account number to make selecting accounts easier.
The typical balance, so negative balances can be highlighted in reports.
A section sub-total flag indicating that this account is the last in a group on the Trial Balance and Worksheet.
A counter balance account to make entering paired accounts easier. (For Example, Accumulated Depreciation and Depreciation Expense)
An auto-distribution code to automatically distribute amounts in Journal entries.
Whether to close this account at year-end (ie., Expense or Income accounts).
Set this account as discontinued (To phase out an account that may still have active postings).

ClassHelp.paragraph:
To display the transaction detail for an account, click on the
Detail screen=AcctDetailGridScreen Detail
(Account Inquiry) button.

In the account grid display screen, you can reorder the list by either account number or description by clicking on the column heading. To find a particular account, enter the starting description in the "Desc Filter" box and press tab.
Note: If you delete an account that has transactions, the account will be marked as discontinued rather than being deleted.
First, enter the Chart of Accounts account number, then select comparative or budget information for this account.
Enter the period ending date and the balance for each account.
This information is used in the financial statement printing modules.
Note: Comparative information is usually only entered for pre-system years, as most reports can retrieve the comparative figures from the past period's transactions.

This information is used in the financial statement printing modules.

This information is used in the financial statement printing modules.

This module is used to enter transactions to be posted to the General Ledger.
There are two types of batches: recurring and one-time batches.
One-time batches are automatically cleared after posting, while recurring batches remain after posting so they can be used again.
To display the recurring batches, click on the "Recurring" check-box in the toolbar. To display another user's batch, select their name from the pop-up box.
For each batch, enter a date, comment, and a source code. These values will automatically be transferred to each posted transaction.
Note: Recurring entries do not have transaction dates until they are posted.

To see the detail transactions, click the
Batch Transaction Detail Entry Detail record=AcctBatchDetail
button.

Note: There is a special button in the Batch Header maintenance screen for automatically creating period-end closing transactions. Just press the
Auto-closing Go record=AcctBatchPost
button. A closing transaction will be created for each account designated as an income/expense. Then you can go to the detail batch screen and finish the batch with any entrie(s) to Income Summary or Retained Earnings.
Only enter closing entries in this batch.

To post the detail transactions to the General Ledger, click the Batch Transaction
Posting Post record=AcctBatchPost
button.

ClassInfo.ClassExplain: General Journal transactions, Recurring Journal Entries

ClassHelp.paragraph: Upon entering this program, the batch header information and all your current transactions will display.
For each transaction, enter an account number and an amount in the Debit or the Credit column.

The sequence number is assigned automatically for each transaction. The sequence number is incremented each time the transaction batch total is zero. The sequence number is only used to order the transactions, so they are easier to group. You may change the sequence numbers at any time.
If an account is entered that has a counter-balance field then the counter balance account will automatically be added to this transaction.
If an account is entered that has an auto-distribution code, the auto-distribution entries will be added to this transaction.

If you are entering an accrual that needs to be reversed at the start of the next period, just enter the complete transaction and click the
Create Auto-Reversing Entries Auto-Reversal Reversal
button. An entry will be created to reverse the transaction. When you post the transaction you may enter the date for the auto-reversal entries in the batch posting screen.
Note: To create an auto-reversal, the entire batch must be balanced, one of the entries in the transaction must be selected, and the selected transaction must be balanced.

ClassInfo.ClassExplain: Post batch transactions to the General Ledger

ClassHelp.paragraph:
There may be a small delay entering this program, as it recounts the balance for all the detail tranactions.
If this is a recurring batch, you will be required to enter a transaction date before continuing.
If this batch contains any auto-accural reversal entries, then the first date of the next accounting period will display (which you may change before posting).

When you press the
Post Post record=AcctBatchPost
button, all the transactions in the batch will be posted to the General Ledger. If the batch is not a recurring batch, then the batch and the detail will be cleared.

Note: Transactions posted manually are treated differently than transactions posted automatically from sub-systems:
Transactions are not summarized. Each transaction becomes an individual transaction in the General Journal.
The transaction detail does not refer to the originating transaction, because the original transaction is cleared.

ClassInfo.ClassExplain: Display detail transactions in a specified period.

ClassHelp.paragraph: To display the detail transaction for an account, enter:

item-list.item: The General Ledger account number.
A beginning and ending date (defaults to current period).

ClassHelp.paragraph: The system will display the activity for this account during this period.

Note: If you want to see the beginning balance for an account click on the Start Balance check box. There may be a slight delay as the system must read through all the transactions before that date to calculate the amount.
If you don't display the starting balance, the ending balance is the change for the transactions displayed.
Note: The balances will not display unless all transactions are displayed on the screen. To get the start and end balances, just scroll to the bottom of the transaction list.

To display the transaction distribution (the audit trail) for a transaction, click on the
Detail screen=AcctDetailDistGridScreen Detail
(Transaction Distribution Inquiry) button.

ClassInfo.ClassDesc: Recompute the end balance if start or change changes

ClassHelp.paragraph: The Account Transaction Distribution displays the source of a G/L Transaction.
This is the audit trail back to the originating transactions.

To display the all of the transaction distribution for this transaction, click on the
Detail Detail record=AcctDetailDist
button.
You would only press this button if you are in the maintenance screen to see the rest of the distribution for this transaction. Pressing this from the grid screen will redisplay the same data.

To display the distribution group, click on the
Group Group screen=AcctDetailDistGroupGridScreen
button. The distribution group is the complete original source transaction.

To display the source transaction, click on the
Source trx Source
button. The screen displayed will depend on the source of the transaction. (ie., For a cash deposit, the original Bank Transaction will display)

Often you will see a
Transaction record=AcctDetail Transaction
button. This button will display the top-level G/L posting transaction.

This Program maintains the Airline file.

Control file maintenance is used to make entering data in the other programs faster. Some of the values are used as default values in the other programs, and some of the values control other program's operations.
The cutoff report details the costs of tours which were owed but not yet paid at the cut-off date.
The report will include the cost for all tours which depart on this date or before, but were not paid (and may not yet be paid) until after the cutoff date.
This report will read the A/P detail for each vendor. If the departure date of the tour is on or before the cutoff date, then the item is analyzed.

item-list.item: If the item is a Departure estimate, then the estimated cost is included on the report.
If the item is a Invoice, then the invoiced cost is included on the report. If any payments were made before the cut-off date, they are subtracted from the invoice amount.

ClassHelp.paragraph: If the item is a paid Invoice, then it is included only if payments were made AFTER the cut-off date. (If the invoice was paid before the cut-off date, the cost is included in the cash receipts journal) - Credit memo's are handled exactly as invoices (if associated with a tour)

Note: This program is usually used to manually verify the estimated tour cost in the General Ledger. The total on this report is estimated tour cost and will be included as a cost of tours if you are on an accrual basis.

To have the system print all the line items, including the items with zero balances, click on the "Show Paid Items" checkbox.
This screen displays the A/P Transaction detail.
You may change some of the fields for A/P transactions, but the items that can be changed on this screen have no effect on the general ledger, so no journal entries are created.
You have several detail screen options:

item-list.item: Product detail Product detail ?record=BookingDetail Detail - The detail products for an invoice.
Payment history Payment history ?record=PaymentHistory Price - The check or prepayment used to pay for an invoice or prepayment.
Payment distribution Payment distribution ?screen=PaymentHistoryLinkTrxGridScreen Distribution - The distribution of a payment or prepayment to specific invoices.
Distribution Distribution ?record=AcctDetailDist Distribution - The G/L Distribution
Tour display Tour display ?record=ApTrx Display - Display all of the A/P detail for the tour of the selected item.
Vendor display Vendor display ?record=ApTrx Display - Display all of the A/P detail for the vendor of the selected item.

ClassHelp.paragraph: Note: Not all of these items display on all the A/P Transaction screens.

ClassInfo.ClassExplain: Prints the tickets issued, changed, and cancelled each week.

ClassHelp.paragraph: The ARC report prints all the pending tickets to be submitted to the ARC and changes their status when they are submitted.

All tickets with a status of "Ticketed" and without an ARC update date with a ticketing date before or on the entered date will be included in this report. If you post the tickets, the ticket's ARC update date will be set to the system date and their status will change to ARC submitted.
Tickets which have been changed or cancelled are also included on this report. The resulting G/L transactions is similar to the transaction for tickets.
The ARC transaction will look like this:
A/R Transactions are automatically created and updated when the tour price or payments change.
A/R Transactions are also linked to the financial systems. All A/R transactions are distributed to the general ledger.

Auto-distributions are very simple.
First, enter a descriptive title for the distribution.

Then enter the detail accounts and the percentage to distribute to each account. It is recommended that the distribution equal 100%, but it is not required (to give you the option of completing the transaction in Journal Entry).
When you enter an account in Journal Entry that has an auto-distribution, the auto-distribution accounts are automatically counter-posted to the transaction.

To display the current account balance, just check the "Balance?" checkmark.
To void a transaction, click on the "delete" button. The transaction will not be deleted, but will be zeroed and the G/L postings will be reversed.

Distribution screen=BankTrxDistGridScreen Distribution
button.

Payment Distribution screen=PaymentHistoryLinkTrxGridScreen Price
button. The screen that displays depends on the type of Bank Transaction:

item-list.item:
If the transaction is an Accounts Receivable deposit, the
Payment Distribution (A/R) screen=ArTrxLinkTrxGridScreen Price screen will display.

If the transaction is an Accounts Payable payment, the
Payment Distribution (A/P) screen=PaymentHistoryLinkTrxGridScreen Price screen will display.

Asset Debt Control Form record=AssetDrControl file.

Note: To enter a void check, just enter a check with an amount of zero and a payee of VOID. This will not create any entries, but will maintain the complete list of check numbers for the audit trail.

ClassInfo.ClassDesc: Calculate the balance for the bank transactions

ClassHelp.paragraph: The Account Transaction Distribution displays the source of a G/L Transaction.
This is the audit trail back to the originating transactions.

To display the all of the transaction distribution for this transaction, click on the
Detail Detail record=AcctDetailDist
button.
You would only press this button if you are in the maintenance screen to see the rest of the distribution for this transaction. Pressing this from the grid screen will redisplay the same data.

To display the distribution group, click on the
Group Group screen=AcctDetailDistGroupGridScreen
button. The distribution group is the complete original source transaction.

To display the source transaction, click on the
Source trx Source
button. The screen displayed will depend on the source of the transaction. (ie., For a cash deposit, the original Bank Transaction will display)

Often you will see a
Transaction record=AcctDetail Transaction
button. This button will display the top-level G/L posting transaction.

ClassInfo.ClassDesc: Header Screen for Bank Trx dist.

ClassHelp.paragraph: This program displays the transactions for a bank account.
To display the current account balance, just check the "Balance?" checkmark.
To void a transaction, click on the "delete" button. The transaction will not be deleted, but will be zeroed and the G/L postings will be reversed.

To display the General Ledger distribution for a bank account transaction detail, just press the
Distribution screen=BankTrxDistGridScreen Distribution
button.

To display the payment distribution for a bank account transaction detail, just press the
Payment Distribution screen=PaymentHistoryLinkTrxGridScreen Price
button. The screen that displays depends on the type of Bank Transaction:

item-list.item:
If the transaction is an Accounts Receivable deposit, the
Payment Distribution (A/R) screen=ArTrxLinkTrxGridScreen Price screen will display.

If the transaction is an Accounts Payable payment, the
Payment Distribution (A/P) screen=PaymentHistoryLinkTrxGridScreen Price screen will display.

Distribution screen=BankTrxDistGridScreen Distribution
button.

To display the payment distribution for a bank account transaction detail, just press the
Payment Distribution screen=PaymentHistoryLinkTrxGridScreen Price
button. The screen that displays depends on the type of Bank Transaction:

item-list.item:
If the transaction is an Accounts Receivable deposit, the
Payment Distribution (A/R) screen=ArTrxLinkTrxGridScreen Price screen will display.

If the transaction is an Accounts Payable payment, the
Payment Distribution (A/P) screen=PaymentHistoryLinkTrxGridScreen Price screen will display.

Enter profile information for a booking

ClassHelp.paragraph: Enter the profile or main contact information for a booking.

You may:
1. Enter all of the contact information manually, or
2. Click on the.
Lookup record=Profile Lookup
button to select an agency or passenger from the Profile record=Profile screen, or
3. Click on the.
Form record=Profile Form
button to enter a new Profile record=Profile and associate it with this booking.

To clear the contact information on this screen, click on the
Reset record=Profile Reset
button.
Any information that you change in this screen will also be changed in the Profile record=Profile record.

The standard commission field sets the default commission rate for the pricing screen. The language preference sets the language for the booking and the currency preference sets the currency for the costing and pricing screens.
Lookup and enter new bookings.
In the booking lookup screen you can search for bookings by Booking, Tour Template, or Tour Departure.

The booking entry screen allows you to create and modify a booking.
You can modify your booking using the following sub-screens:
Tour information entry screen.

Select a tour and a departure date to start the booking process.
You may select a tour from the drop-down list or click on the Tour Lookup Lookup record=TourHeader button to use the tour header lookup screen.
Enter a departure date to select a tour header and initiate a booking.
Note: For Series Tours, you may press the
Lookup button next to the departure date to select a series departure.

After selecting a tour header and a departure date, the tour screen will be populated from information in the Tour Header record=TourHeader and the Tour Class record=TourClass files. Any of these fields may be changed.
Also, all of the detail screens will be populated depending on the detail information in the Tour Header Option Detail record=TourHeaderOption .

If there are options that require answers, the Options images/tour/buttons/Options.gif record=BookingAnswer button will be enabled. If there is any required information, you will automatically be switched to the Booking Option Booking Option images/tour/buttons/Options.gif record=BookingAnswer screen.
This screen displays the basic information for a booking.
Lookup and enter new bookings.
In the booking lookup screen you can search for bookings by Booking, Tour Template, or Tour Departure.

The booking entry screen allows you to create and modify a booking.
You can modify your booking using the following sub-screens:

The booking option selection screen is used to select Tour Options. The tour options selected will add tour components to a booking. The components will only be added if the criteria for the option are met, either automatically (For example, a weekend surcharge selected based on the day of the week) or manually (such as a hotel upgrade).
A/R Transactions are automatically created and updated when the tour price or payments change.
A/R Transactions are also linked to the financial systems. All A/R transactions are distributed to the general ledger.

ClassInfo.ClassDesc: Booking entry sub-screen to manipulate itinerary using a calendar screen

ClassHelp.paragraph: The calendar screen is the primary screen for FIT building.

Mouse functions operate as follows: Clicking on a calendar box selects it.
Product Icon: Click - selects, Drag and Drop changes.
Product Description: Click - changes detail info, Drag and Drop changes start date, Shift/Ctrl Click add to selection
Product end icon: click - selects, Drap and Drop changes end date, Shift/Ctrl click add to selection.
Maintain the default booking values.
Lookup and enter new bookings.
In the booking lookup screen you can search for bookings by Booking, Tour Template, or Tour Departure.

The booking entry screen allows you to create and modify a booking.
You can modify your booking using the following sub-screens:
Booking hotel information can be entered and changed here.

Enter a hotel, check in date, and the number of nights.
You can also set the room class and the rate type for the hotel.
On the right side of the screen you can select the meals that the hotel should supply. There are fields for the number of meals and the day the meal should be served (where day 0 is the check-in date).
The system will automatically retrieve the hotel rates and calculate a total for the passengers in this booking. Rate retrieval is programmed in the Hotel Mainteance record=Hotel Help screen.

There are three buttons at the bottom of the screen for displaying the Room pricing record=HotelPricing images/tour/buttons/Price.gif , Meal pricing record=HotelMealPricing images/tour/buttons/Meal.gif , and Room inventory record=Inventory images/tour/buttons/Inventory.gif from the internal system.
Several fields are used in all Booking Detail record=BookingDetail Help screens. The Booking Detail record=BookingDetail Help screen also explains in detail how messages are send to product vendors.

The state of the four status fields depends of the information available. Once enough information is available, the system attempts to retieve the information required for the status. If any of the dependent fields change, the system automatically re-retrieves the new information and updates the status.

This screen is used to display and change the booking pricing.

Pricing line items are added automatically as products are added to the booking. Any item that you add or change will have a pricing status of 'Manual', meaning the the price will not change automatically when the product is changed.

Pricing line items are added automatically as products are added to the booking. Any item that you add or change will have a pricing status of 'Manual', meaning the the price will not change automatically when the product is changed.
Enter or change the passenger information for a booking.

The passenger name is automatically split up into Title, First, Middle, and Last name. The single passenger entry screen allows you to enter these fields individually as well as enter some additional passenger information.

When you select the single passenger entry screen you can lookup a single passenger from the the
Profile lookup record=Profile screen by clicking on the Lookup
(lookup) button.

In addition to the standard toolbar buttons, there are two extra buttons:
1. The
Select passengers record=Profile Lookup
button. When you press this button, the Profile lookup record=Profile screen will appear displaying only contact type profiles. Selecting a profile from this screen will add all of the passengers from this profile to this booking. In adddition, if a profile has not already been selected from the Booking Profile Screen screen=BookingAgencyScreen , this profile will be selected as the current booking profile.
2. The
Add to passengers tour/buttons/Passenger
button adds all the passengers in this booking to the profile file and then displays the new main Profile record=Profile in a new window.

You can modify your booking using the following sub-screens:
Maintain the booking status descriptions.
This program is used to enter foreign currency draft(s) purchased from a currency broker or a bank.
The system needs to know who each draft is payable to, the amount, and the exchange rates for each draft.
First, enter the vendor code of the broker you are purchasing the draft from (defaults to the broker vendor in the control file).
The current drafts will display on the screen.

For each draft, enter the vendor code of the payee, and the amount of the draft (The amount defaults to the current selected amount) and the U.S. Dollar amount of the purchase, or the exchange rate (the system will calculate the U.S. dollar amount for you).
After all of the amounts have been entered, you should request either a manual or automatic check request and post the check(s).

To see the resulting G/L entries, take a look at
Check printing ?screen=PrintCheckJournal Form .

After the broker is paid, the broker drafts will appear in each vendor's account (it acts just like a prepayment).
Then, it will have to be distributed to specific invoices in
Prepayment Distribution Form screen=PrepaymentDistScreen .
If auto-update is selected in the control file, then the current exchange rate in the currency file will be updated when the check for the broker is printed.

If the broker charges a service change on the exchange, enter an invoice amount for the service change. The service charge will automatically be selected for payment along with the broker amounts. Do not enter the service charge in this program. To see the total check amount, use vendor payment selection.

Enter and maintain Brochure bundle descriptions and contents.
Brochure bundles make brochure entry easier by selecting a bundle (such as Asia Brochures) instead of having to select each brochure individually.

To specify the particular brochures belonging to a brochure bundle, press the
Detail Detail record=BundleDetail
button.

Use these screens to display and maintain the Rental Car information. Use the maintenance screen to add and change Rental Cars. Use the display screen to view all the Rental Cars. Enter a rate type, class and date to display rental car pricing. Checking the "Remote lookup?" box will retrieve rental car prices from remote sources.
The initial message status and message transport fields are explained in the general Product record=Product Help help.

When entering rental cars, enter or lookup a
Vendor Lookup record=Vendor from the accounting system.
There are several detail screens for a rental car:
Product classes are varing service levels, such as first class, etc.
Enter and change credit card information.

ClassInfo.ClassDesc: Field to display the card type

ClassHelp.paragraph: This program is used to enter all incoming checks for bookings (both deposits and final payments).
Program Operation:
Usually this program is easy to operate because the payment is returned with the confirmation payment stub. The stub has the booking number printed on it, making receipt entry very simple.

You can either enter the booking number if you know it, or you can press the
Lookup screen=BookingGridScreen Lookup
button to find the booking by the agency's ARC number.

To enter a non-tour related cash receipt or a payment to multiple bookings, press the
Distribution record=CashBatchDist Distribution
button. In the distribution screen, you can apply the check amount to bookings and/or general ledger accounts.

For each check received, you may also enter the check number, and ABA number (If deposit slips are printed). The check amount defaults to the deposit amount for the initial payment and the outstanding balance for subsequent payments.
Once a deposit is posted, the booking's internal status is changed to "Accepted" and the A/R detail is set-up.
The A/R account that is credited is the one that is listed in the booking record. The A/R account in the booking record comes from the tour header.
For example, the G/L entry for a batch of checks for two bookings and a purchase rebate:

ClassInfo.ClassExplain: This program posts all of the cash receipts detail currently in the system to the A/R detail.

ClassHelp.paragraph: The current batch header is displayed first. To continue, hit return at the CHANGE ITEM prompt.

After the report is finished, review it to make sure it is correct. If it is correct, answer yes to the question, "Are you sure you want to post to A/R?" The current batch will be posted to the A/R detail and cleared from A/R cash entry.
After posting, you will be returned to the A/R main menu.
Note: During posting you may get a message that a booking is locked. If this happens, have the person locking the booking finish their session, then type Yes to continue.

button to find the booking by the agency's ARC number.

To enter a non-tour related cash receipt or a payment to multiple bookings, press the
Distribution record=CashBatchDist Distribution
button. In the distribution screen, you can apply the check amount to bookings and/or general ledger accounts.

For each check received, you may also enter the check number, and ABA number (If deposit slips are printed). The check amount defaults to the deposit amount for the initial payment and the outstanding balance for subsequent payments.
Once a deposit is posted, the booking's internal status is changed to "Accepted" and the A/R detail is set-up.
The A/R account that is credited is the one that is listed in the booking record. The A/R account in the booking record comes from the tour header.

ClassInfo.ClassExplain: Print the cash receipts planning report.

ClassHelp.paragraph: This program is used to estimate future cash receipts based on current sales.
Enter the starting date, period length (days) and number of periods.
Remember, a tour is only considered if the status is "Okay" or some money has been received (This is the definition of an accepted tour).

Of course, this program can only estimate future cash receipts. To get a more accurate estimate of future cash receipts, this report can be run for periods past and then be compared against the previous estimates to get an idea of the relation between the estimates and the actual values.

ClassInfo.ClassExplain: Enter credit memos and debit memos.

ClassHelp.paragraph: This program is used for entering credit memos and debit memos into the A/R open item file. A credit memo is treated exactly like a payment in the A/R system; It reduces the amount owed by the customer. A debit memo is treated exactly like a charge in the A/R system; It increases the amount owed by the customer.

For example, the customer did some marketing for you and instead of being reimbursed, you could credit the amount to a booking by entering a credit memo. If a customer bounced a check, a debit memo would be entered.
Program Operation:
Enter the booking number that you want to adjust. The booking information and the current A/R transactions will display.

The Transaction code (Credit memo or Debit memo) will automatically be set depending on whether the amount is a negative (credit) or positive (debit). Enter the date (defaults to today), G/L number, and the comment. The G/L number defaults to the account in the control file. If you want a specific G/L account, you must enter it in the Form screen (not the grid display). The counter account is always the Accounts Receivable set in the control screen.
All of the transactions entered will be posted to G/L after entering the transactions.
Sample G/L entries:

A credit memo is a credit towards a vendor's account. The system treats it like an invoice. Credit memos are used to increase the amount owed to a vendor. For example, a check is lost in transit. Enter a credit memo and re-enter the payment.

Enter the vendor number that the credit will be applied toward. Enter the tour number if this cost can be assigned to a tour. Also, enter a short description of the credit, and the credit amount. The credit amount immediatedly is added to the vendor's open balance. It is also selected for full payment.

Next, enter the G/L account that this cost will be charged to (debited). This defaults to the G/L account in the vendor record. Then enter the A/P account the credit will be applied to. This default to the non-tour G/L acct.
This program can also be used to adjust or delete a credit memo. The memo can't be adjusted or deleted after the G/L update has been done.

The credit memo is posted to the G/L on the entry date. If an accrual has to be done, it must be done in the G/L system. The amount is converted to US Dollars at the current rate and is treated the same as an invoice when payment is made.
Note: Internally, a credit memo is treated as an invoice. To clear the credit memo from the vendor's account, just include it in a check request or distribute a prepayment to it.
A G/L transaction is created for credit memos. For example:
Remember: A Credit memo is usually in the form of a DEBIT memo from a vendor. Just remember, for a credit memo, the vendor is owed the amount of the credit.

ClassInfo.ClassExplain: Process a group of credit card charges.

ClassHelp.paragraph: First enter the card to submit the credit cards to. Then enter the service change (if applicable).
The program will automatically update the status of the credit cards to "Submitted" when you confirm the print-out.
A G/L entry doesn't have to be made, because the adjustment to A/R was made already in the credit card entry program.

Most of the booking product detail screens share the following fields:

item-list.item: Total cost - The total cost of this product in the product and booking currency.
Status - The overall product status (If the product item is flashing, the information, inventory, cost, or product status are not set)
Info. status - The status of the information retrieved from the product (ie., vendor, currency, etc).
Inv. status - The product availability status.
Cost status - The status of the cost retrieved from the product.
Order status - The product order status.
Wait for ack - The number of days to wait for an order response before flagging the order in the Tour Order Status record=TourOrderStatus report.
Markup fm last - If the current year's prices are not available, the cost will be calculated by marking up last year's cost by this amount.

ClassHelp.paragraph:
Most of the product detail status process messages in the same way:
If the information can be retrieved automatically (such as direct lookup, local message, or Web Services) the message will be immediately sent to the vendor.
If the information has to be processed manually by the vendor (such as email, etc) the message will not be sent until you press the status button.
If the status has changed manually (such as a phone call to the res center) you will have to change the transport method to "manual" and then change the status on the screen.
If the status is showing "error" or "data required" just press the message button to display the actual error in the status bar at the bottom of the screen.
For a description of each message transport type, see the Message Transport record=MessageTransport Help information. For a description of the status, see the Base Message Status record=BaseMessageStatus Help information.

item-list.item: Product Information- When enough information exists to retrieve the product information (usually just the product and a date), the detail product is created from the product information and the tour information. Information such as rate type and product class are filled in here.

Product Cost and Pricing Information - Once enough information is available to retrieve a cost (Usually date, rate type, and rate class), the product cost is retrieved. The method of contacting the product's vendor is retrieved from the first non-blank message type in this hierarchy: Product Record -> Product Control File -> Vendor Record -> Vendor control file. The instruction for sending this message (and receiving a response) are retrieved from first non-blank entry in the same hierarchy.
The Cost status will change to "in-process" until a response has been received. Clicking on the "Manual Cost" checkbox will change the status to "Okay" and enable the cost fields so you can manually enter the cost.
Product Inventory Information -
Product Sales Information -

ClassInfo.ClassDesc: Days of week - Each bit represents a day of the week. 0 = Sunday, etc. If the bit is ZERO (0) then the day is valid. If this field is null, all days are valid.

ClassHelp.paragraph: This screen displays all the Product detail in date order.

A debit memo is a charge against a vendor's account (Debit A/P). It is treated just like an prepayment. The major difference is that a check doesn't have to be printed to affect the vendor's account balance. For example, you pay a tour operator in merchandise, instead of cash. The amount which the vendor values the merchandise is the amount of the debit memo. A frequent use for debit memo entry is to correct errors in estimates or invoices after they have been posted to A/P.

Enter the Vendor, the Debit Description, and amount. If the debit memo is in a currency other than U.S. dollars, then you will be asked for the USD amount. This is the amount posted to the General Ledger. Next, enter the A/P number to debit (Defaults to Vendor's default) and the account to Credit (defaults to the prepayment default).
Note: To enter a negative amount against a tour, use invoice entry and type a negative amount (For a credit invoice).
Note: Internally, debit memos are treated the same as prepayments. You must use the prepayment distribution program to distribute the amounts to specific invoices.
G/L entries are created automatically:
This program is also used to fix estimates and invoices after they have been posted to A/P. You can zero out the incorrect invoice by distributing a debit memo to it.

For example, say you enter a departure estimate for 910.00 rather than 190.00 and you didn't catch it on the edit list. To fix it, enter a fake invoice for the 910.00, enter a debit memo for 910.00 and then distribute the debit memo to the invoice to cancel it out. Go back and enter the correct departure estimate. (Usually you wouldn't go through all this trouble for an estimate. You would only do it for an incorrect invoice)
The entry from the debit memo posting would be:

The sequence number determines the order in which the statements are evaluated. This is important if the later statements contain data from earlier statements.
Next, enter the description of the statement.
If the statement is an Income Statement or Balance sheet, select the appropriate Statement type, otherwise leave the statement type blank.
There are two possible statement formats; a three column format or a single column and a ratio.
Select the value that you want in the statement, either the Net change in the period (ie., Income Statement) or the To-date balance (ie., Balance Sheet).

The
Go Validate
button checks the Financial Statements to make sure all of the accounts are contained in the Financial Statements. If an account is missing, it is added to the end of the last statement. It is a good idea to press this button every once in a while to make sure all the accounts are included.
The statements might contain an Income Statement, Statement of Retained Earnings, and a Balance Sheet. Or it might only contain a Statement of Changes in Financial Position.

To see the statement detail click the
Detail record=FinStmtDetail Statement Detail
button.

ClassInfo.ClassExplain: This program is used to format the Financial Statements.

ClassHelp.paragraph:
These are the fields you can change on this screen:
The sequence number. This determines the ordering of this item on the financial statement.
The G/L account number. This is not mandatory, you can leave this line blank and enter text to appear on the financial statement.
The Description. This field defaults to the description in the chart of accounts, but you may change it to a description which is more appropiate for a financial statement. If you don't want the description to display, you will have to check the "invisible" check mark.
Indent. Enter a number, up to three to determine the amount this description is indented.
Invisible. If this field is set to Yes, this field will not display. The amount will be added to the subsequent field.
Parenthesis control. If the amount is not this balance, a parenthesis will be around the amount in the statement.
Sub-total Level. Total all amount of this level or smaller. 9 is the highest sub-total level. (For example, if you do a level 3 sub-total all amount up to the last level 3 subtotal will be aggregated and level 1,2, and 3 subtotals will be reset). Remember that sub-totals span all the statements, so for example, the income amount can be moved to the retained earnings statement by using sub-totals.
Column. For multi-column formats, this field specifies the column to have this amount appear. (3 columns maximum)
Special. Special XML Tag to place around this amount. (Typically an XSL-FO style). Special formats come from the
Special Format record=SpecialFormat Form screen.
The statement. You can switch an account to another statement by changing this field.
Number formats come from the
Number Format record=NumberFormat Form screen.
Special functions come from the
Special Functions record=SpecialFunction Form screen.
The Renumber Go button is used to renumber the sequence numbers by 10, so it is easier to add and move around accounts.
These are the general capabilities of the statement formatting program:

item-list.item: Add detail accounts together to arrive at a sub-total account (whether profit center accounts or sub-accounts) (also consolidate accounts into a postable or fake account)
Sub-totals at any level (up to grand total)
Move profit/loss from Income Statement to Balance Sheet (through retained earnings report)
Ratios on Income Statement and supporting schedules (option to include each line in ratio control)
Column control on Balance Sheet
Inventory handling in Income statement (Beginning & End) and in Balance Sheet (end)
Blank lines
Page feed
Headers
Multiple line headers and text
Statement title format
Underlines & double underlines

Use this screen to setup, change, and close inventory for a product.

An inventory can be allocated for each day, rate, class, and other attribute for each product. If the rate, class, and/or other attribute are blank, the inventory will be allocated to any category in the blank category.
The Oversell amount allows the product to be sold beyond the alloted inventory. This oversell amount should be reduced as the inventory date draws near.
Closing a date will prevent further sales regardless of the availability.

To add, change, or delete a block of dates at once, press the Range adjustment images/tour/buttons/Inventory.gif record=Inventory button. From this screen, you may enter a date range and new values. Any fields left blank will be unchanged in the range. To delete a range, click the delete checkbox. Press the Adjust range images/tour/buttons/Inventory.gif record=Inventory to make the adjustments.

ClassHelp.paragraph: This program is used to enter invoices from vendors. You typically will select estimates from the vendor estimate display. You may also enter or change a manual invoice here.
Enter the Vendor, tour (optional), Invoice number, date and amount for each invoice. The A/P and cost accounts are only for non-tour invoices.

All of the invoices entered are automatically selected for payment, so creating the check in
Payment Selection screen=GenPaymentSelect Form
will be simple.
If the invoice amount is different from the departure estimated a gain or loss will be recognized.

Note: This system should be used to enter all costs directly related to a tour. For example, Tour director checks should be entered here, then a check should be requested in this system, rather than entering the check in Asset/Debt maintenance.

Note: Also remember that invoices are posted to the General Ledger on the Invoice date. If you have material cost for a tour, enter it in the
Departure estimate ?screen=DepEstScreen Form screen, so the cost will be posted on the tour departure date.

screen.

Leave the rate and/or class blank if they are not applicable.

There are two possible classes, Seat-in-Car/Seat-in-Motorcoach or private vehicle. If a SIC price exists, the user will be offered a choice of SIC or Private Car/Coach in FIT Land entry.
You may enter a passenger category to cost by individual passenger or per room type (ie., single supplement per person, etc...)
The " Varies by code record=LandVaries Help " is used to enter costs or prices that vary by another factor than passenger. Costs can vary by per-person cost, fixed cost to be allocated to all the passengers proportionately, or room cost. If you selected the "manual" version, the user will be prompted for a value before arriving at a cost. (ie., for a per-day cost on a Rent-a-Car, the user would be asked for the number of days in booking entry)
Note: Remember the answer to a variable question is a two digit number. If the number requires a larger number use a larger base (For example, miles X 100).

The land varies codes are used to specify how each component of the land cost is calculated. (ie., by passenger, by day, etc.)
The Varies by field determines how this field is included in the land cost:

item-list.item: Per person - will be included for each passenger
Fixed - will be added once to the tour cost
Per room - will be added for each room

ClassHelp.paragraph: Each of these items also has a version that is manual. This means that the user will be prompted for a quantity before the cost can be determined. This can be useful for example for a per-day or per-mile charge. Remember to select the correct manual cost (ie., per-day-per-passenger).

All the ISO langage descriptions and codes.
You can access an MCO either by the booking number, or the actual MCO number. Entering the first numbers of the MCO number will display all matching MCOs in order.
If there are more than one MCOs for one booking, then they will all display.
If the MCO has not been posted to the General Ledger yet, the amounts may be changed. The amounts may only be changed for report use, the actual amount posted to the booking may not be changed.

If the amount posted to a booking is incorrect, first change the MCO information to the correct values, so the MCO submission will be correct, then enter a credit or debit memo to the booking with distribution to the MCO variance account. This will insure all entries are correct.
For example:
MCO net should have been $900, but was posted as $1000.
First, change the MCO amount to 1000. Then enter a debit memo for $100. The booking will show the correct amount. If the carrier pays $1000, the G/L entries will be:
The debit memo will produce:
leaving all accounts in the correct state.

ClassInfo.ClassExplain: This program is used update the amount received from a carrier for MCOs.

ClassHelp.paragraph: This program updates the MCO status from submited to paid and posts an entry in the G/L to negate the A/R (mco) balance.
For example, the G/L entry for a batch of MCOs might be:
Remember to Credit the Suspense account (not the A/R MCO account) when you deposit the check in the Asset Debt system.

If the difference in an MCO is collected later, just enter the MCO as a new sale, with the distribution (income) going to the variance account. This will provide the most accurate representation of the transaction.

ClassInfo.ClassExplain: This program is used to enter the amount received from a carrier for MCOs.

ClassHelp.paragraph:
First, enter or lookup the booking number. If this MCO should be distributed to multiple bookings, you may press the
screen=McoBatchDistScreen Detail Distribution Distribution
button.

For each MCO received, you may enter the MCO number, carrier code, Net MCO amount, Commission percentage or amount, Tax box, and the service charge percentage or amount. The net amount will display automatically.
The MCO calculations are done as follows:

Net = Gross - Commission - Taxes - Service charge
Commission = Gross * Commission %
Taxes = Gross * Tax %
Service charge = Gross * Service charge %

To Post the MCOs to the G/L, click on the
screen=McoPost Post Post (Mco Posting)
button

ClassHelp.paragraph: To post to A/R, you must supply the system with the proper A/R account for the MCOs receivable (Defaults to the account in the control file). This account is the amount of MCOs collected but not yet received from the carriers.
The A/R account that is credited is the one that is listed in the MCO record.
For example, the G/L entry for a batch of MCOs might be:
Note: If you make a mistake on an MCO and then post it, then you will have to run the submission report for the erroneous MCO and then credit the A/R account (and the booking) in credit entry.

ClassInfo.ClassExplain: Enter air overrides paid by an airline.

ClassHelp.paragraph: Override processing is done is two steps:

item-list.item: 1. Submit an override report to the carrier.
2. Enter the actual overrides received for each ticket in the override screen.

ClassHelp.paragraph: To use the override entry screen, enter the carrier code and the starting and ending TICKET departure date to process overrides receipts for (The same dates entered when the submission report was run).
All the tickets in the range for the carrier selected will display in departure date order.
For each ticket, enter the amount of override received. The amount defaults to the amount submitted to the carrier.
You may change a receipt by entering the ticket number and re-entering the amount.

The overrides will immediately be posted to the General Ledger. For example:
11/17/07
Override Summary Account 55.50
Gain/Loss on Overrides recvd 11.50
Overrides Receivable 67.00
Note: It is therefore important that the check received from the carrier is distributed to the override summary account:
11/17/07
Cash 55.50
Override Summary Account 55.50
Override processing is done is two steps:

item-list.item: 1. Submit an override report to the carrier.
2. Enter the actual overrides received for each ticket in the override screen.

ClassHelp.paragraph: Enter the carrier code and the starting and ending TICKET departure date to process overrides receipts for.
All the tickets in the range for the carrier selected will print in ticket departure date order.
If you enter an override date, all the paid overrides entered for that date will print.

Check to see if this booking is past-due
Footing for the past due report
Print past due reports and notices

ClassHelp.paragraph: Enter the "Past due as of" date (defaults to todays date). If a payment is past due as of this date, then it will be included on the report.

The next two questions ask if you want to check the deposit and/or final payment dates. Both of the answers default to yes. The MCO margin keeps deposits which are within the entered percentage from printing on the report (MCO deposits often are written as commissionable).

You have three options for handling the past due items in the report.
First, you can print the report.
Second, you can print reminder notices
Or, you can export the past due data into an XML file to be processed on your own.

Payment codes are user defined codes for selecting a batch of vendors for payments.

When to bill a vendor.
Typically at Invoice, statement, end of month, or prepay.

Enter the vendor code, amount, and a comment for the check. The amount defaults to current selection. If the amount is different from the vendor selection amount, the amount will be set up as a prepayment.

To enter a manually written check, click the Allow manual checks button and enter the check number in the screen. When automated checks are printed, this check will not be included, but when the checks are posted the manual check will be included.

To print the requested checks, click the
Print checks screen=PrintCheckJournal Print
button.
To select checks for a batch of vendors, click on the

button.

program. Check printing is where the posting is done.

Account postings are summarized into these time periods.
Most journal entries will be posted to the period that contains the current date, although it is possible to post in a previous or future period.

To prevent posting from being made in a past period, just enter the current date in the "Closed on" date. Any postings attempted in a closed period, will appear in the first open period. Any postings attempted past the last period will be summarized in the month the transaction is posted.

Note: If you do not summarize your financial information monthly, you should enter your financial periods far into the future to avoid having the system automatically summarize your transactions by month.

ClassInfo.TechnicalInfo: This is one of the few record that don't have an Object ID. No record should every reference a Period directly.

ClassHelp.paragraph: The cutoff report details the payments made but not yet distributed as of the cut-off date. This program is typically used to verify the prepaid cost amount in the General Ledger.

ClassInfo.ClassExplain: Distribute prepayments, debit memos, and broker drafts to specific invoices.

ClassHelp.paragraph: To start, enter the entry number of the prepayment Form ?screen=PrepaymentScreen to distribute.

Once the prepayment is selected, the current selection for this vendor will display. The selection must be equal to or less than the prepayment amount. You don't have to distribute the whole amount. The prepayment may be reduced in more than one distribution.

Notes: This program is also used to distribute debit memos Form ?screen=DebitMemoScreen and
broker payments Form ?screen=BrokerDistGridScreen . Program operation is exactly the same.
A G/L entry is generated for the items distributed to, for example:

Note: Usually, a zero prepayment or debit memo amount cannot be distributed to invoices, because after distribution the internal status is changed to "fully distributed." There is an exception which is allowed to distribute to invoices which are for a zero amount. In this case, a debit memo can be created for a zero amount, and then distribtued to selected invoices with zero amounts. This provides a way of clearing departure estimates for which an amount is never invioced.
To enter a prepayment, enter the vendor and the amount of the prepayment. If the prepayment is for a specific tour, enter the tour also.
You may also enter a starting service date, a description of the prepayment, and an invoice or estimate if this prepayment is for a specific item.
After entering a prepayment request, it will be automatically selected for payment.
Most prepayments requests are automatically generated by the booking system for services that must be paid in advance.

To see the resulting G/L entries, take a look at
Check printing ?screen=PrintCheckJournal Form . Prepayment requests aren't posted until the are paid.

After a prepayment is created and paid, it will have to be distributed to specific invoices in
Prepayment Distribution Form screen=PrepaymentDistScreen .
Note: This program is also used to change and delete current prepayment requests. Once the prepayment request has been paid, it can't be changed or deleted.
This table tells the system whether to auto-select invoices or prepayments for payment.
Enter the bank account you want to print checks for.

Then you must decide whether you want to print the automated checks or print a check register for the manually entered checks. If you select both, then the automated checks will print and the check register will include both the automated checks and the manual checks.
Next, enter the starting check number. The program will ask you to load the checks into the printer before starting to print.
The system automatically prints the checks and posts the proper amounts to the General Ledger Distribtion file.

After the checks have been printed, click on the
Post Post button to post the checks.
The General Ledger distribtion depends on the type of payment. A few samples follow:

credit.description: Gain or Loss on Curr. exchange (Gain)

ClassHelp.paragraph: Note: The transactions posted here will trace back to the payment history rather than the specific A/P transaction, since multiple payment may be made for a single transaction.
There are several message transport fields that determine how information is retrieved from this vendor:

item-list.item: Information - General information such as Product name, etc.
Inventory - Product availability
Cost - Product cost
Ordering - Book the product

ClassHelp.paragraph: Each one of these items have two selections; message transport and initial status. If these values are blank here, the values in the Product Type record=ProductType Help record are used. If the message transport is blank in the product type field also, the value in the Vendor record=Vendor Help file is used.
Note: Leave these fields blank to have the system determine the best way to get the requested information.
Enter product General Ledger account information.
This information is used in the tour header file.

The accounts are used in automatic G/L posting:
The booking transactions on the accounts receivable side are posted like this:
10/15/08 Accounts Receivable - Tours1000.00 Customer Tour Prepayments1000.00 Booking accepted (okayed) by customer (usually deposit received date)
10/15/08 Cash200.00 Accounts Receivable - Tours200.00 Deposit received
12/15/08 Cash800.00 Accounts Receivable - Tours800.00 Final payment received
2/08/08 Customer Tour Prepayments1000.00 Income from tours1000.00 Departure date (Recognize income)
The account 'Customer Tour Prepayments' description may not seem accurate, but actually on the financial statement this account is shown netted with the 'Accounts Receivable - Tours' account(s). Since the A/R account is reduced with each payment, the 'Customer Tour Prepayments' account gives an accurate liability amount until it is recognized as income on the departure date.

The booking transactions on the accounts payable side are posted like this:
10/20/08 Prepayment200.00 Cash200.00 Prepayment for hotel
2/08/08 Cost of Tour - South Pacific800.00 Uninvoiced Tour Cost800.00 Departure date (Recognize expense)
2/28/08 Uninvoiced Tour Cost800.00 Accounts Payable750.00 (Gain)/Loss on Cost Over/Under estimate50.00 Invoice date
3/2/08 Accounts Payable200.00 Prepayment200.00 Distribute prepayment to invoice
3/2/08 Accounts Payable600.00 Cash500.00 (Gain)/Loss on Currency Exchange100.00 Final payment
The 'Uninvoiced Tour Cost' account is usually netted with the 'Accounts Payable' account on the balance sheet, giving an accurate estimated accounts payable amount.
Use this screen to setup, change, and close inventory for a product.

An inventory can be allocated for each day, rate, class, and other attribute for each product. If the rate, class, and/or other attribute are blank, the inventory will be allocated to any category in the blank category.
The Oversell amount allows the product to be sold beyond the alloted inventory. This oversell amount should be reduced as the inventory date draws near.
Closing a date will prevent further sales regardless of the availability.

To add, change, or delete a block of dates at once, press the Range adjustment images/tour/buttons/Inventory.gif record=Inventory button. From this screen, you may enter a date range and new values. Any fields left blank will be unchanged in the range. To delete a range, click the delete checkbox. Press the Adjust range images/tour/buttons/Inventory.gif record=Inventory to make the adjustments.
Enter product status information.

This information is used in the the booking detail screens to show the current status of a product line-item.
For a description of the status messages, see the Base Message Status record=BaseMessageStatus Help description.
General product pricing terms used to calculate the net price.
General product pricing terms used to calculate the net price.
General product pricing terms used to calculate the net price.
List of all tour product types.
This record also contains the default message transport and initial status when an item of this type is entered in a booking. This field is used if the value in the product record is left blank.

Profile classes are user-defined but usually reflect the profile's sales category (Top 5%, Next 10% etc).

The profit center is the three-digit extension on the General Ledger Account number.
Since account numbers and profit centers are options, Profit center descriptions are also optional. Enter the three-digit entension and the profit center description for each profit center.

ClassInfo.ClassDesc: Footing for the Refund check journal

ClassInfo.ClassExplain: Print refund journal and refund checks

ClassHelp.paragraph: Select the bank account refunds are made from. Then enter the date and starting check number.

Pressing the
Print screen=RefundCheckJournal Print
button will print the Refund Journal. This is a summary of the checks that will be printed and to what bookings they apply.

Pressing the
XML checks screen=RefundCheckXMLPrint Print
button or the
Canned checks screen=RefundCheckPrint Print
button will print the checks in either XML format or straight to the printer.

If the checks are all right, click on the
Post screen=RefundCheckPost Post
button to go to the posting screen.
If a refund was done manually, the refund should be entered as a debit memo. Describe the refund on the A/R comment line.

ClassInfo.ClassExplain: Post the refund checks to G/L

ClassHelp.paragraph: When you post the refund checks, the status of the transaction is updated to "Paid", the refund will be posted to the G/L and the check is entered as a bank transaction.

The G/L Transaction will look like this:
16-Feb-03
Refunds Pending 212.45
Cash - Bank account A 212.45
Refund paid.

ClassInfo.ClassDesc: Toolbar for the check printing program

ClassHelp.paragraph: Enter the booking number that you want to enter a refund for. The booking information and the current A/R transactions will display.
Enter a date (defaults to today), amount, and a remark.

Once you enter the refund request, a G/L transaction will be generated. The G/L accounts come from the A/R control file. A temporary liability called refund pending will be set up until the check is printed. The transaction will look something like this:
15-Feb-03
Accounts Receivable 212.45
Refunds Pending 212.45
Request for refund (Temporary transaction).

Refund requests cannot be changed or cancelled once they are entered. To modify or cancel a refund request, use the
Refund Review screen=RefundPendGridScreen Grid
screen.
Note: This screen is usually used to enter refund checks for overpayments or other atypical transactions. Most refund requests are created automatically when a booking is cancelled.
All of the pending refunds will display.
You can hold a refund or mark it as manually paid. Held refunds will stay in the list until they are changed back to submitted.
Refunds marked as manually paid will no longer appear in the list. You must enter a manual G/L entry to apply the refund pending to the correct account after marking a refund as manually paid.
Note:You can only mark a refund as manually paid in the single entry screen, this option does not appear in the grid view.

Form
button will display the
Profile Maintenance Screen record=Profile Help

The
Send Via record=SendVia Help

Salesperson's territories are entered in the
SCF record=SCF Help
file.
Descriptions of the sales regions.

Sales Regions are designated in the
SCF record=SCF Help
file.
The SCF is the first 3 digit of U.S. and Canadian postal codes.
Enter a starting SCF number; If any SCF records contain this range, they are read, otherwise you may enter a new SCF record.
This file contains Salesperson's areas, Sales territories, and UPS and USPS postal zones.
Note: When entering the SCF area description, always include the state code at the end, for state sales analysis. (ie., Los Angeles, CA)
Flight seat preferences.
Descriptions of all possible shipping methods.

ClassInfo.ClassDesc: Set this A/R Trx to a Credit or Debit Memo depending on whether it is positive or negative.
Special 3 state Yes/No/null popup control for this Yes/No field

ClassHelp.paragraph: This program prints an audit-trail of all transactions entered into the general ledger. The entries are printed in transaction-date order within each source code. This organizes all the transactions by their source code (ie., AR, AP, PR, etc.).
You will be asked to enter the following information (all optional):

item-list.item: A starting and ending source code.
Beginning and ending transaction date.
Beginning and ending transaction entry date.

ClassHelp.paragraph: This is the report to use to print auto-posted transaction from each sub-system.
The posting codes for the sub-systems are:

item-list.item: accctrec - Accts/Rec
acctpay - Accts/Pay
assetdr - Asset Debt System
air - Ticketing System
payroll - Payroll System

ClassHelp.paragraph: This report will print a sub-total for each source code and a grand total for all the transactions.

Tax rate display and maintenance.
To display the tax rate for a particuar category, click either the Federal Taxes radio button or the State Taxes button (enter a state to display). Then select the Maritial status popup box.
In the grid, enter the starting annual pay amount and the tax rate that applies to amounts over this cutoff amount.
Note: Since the payroll system is not complete these values are not used yet.
Tax rate display and maintenance.
To display the tax rate for a particuar category, click either the Federal Taxes radio button or the State Taxes button (enter a state to display). Then select the Maritial status popup box.
In the grid, enter the starting annual pay amount and the tax rate that applies to amounts over this cutoff amount.
Note: Since the payroll system is not complete these values are not used yet.
Tax rate display and maintenance.
To display the tax rate for a particuar category, click either the Federal Taxes radio button or the State Taxes button (enter a state to display). Then select the Maritial status popup box.
In the grid, enter the starting annual pay amount and the tax rate that applies to amounts over this cutoff amount.
Note: Since the payroll system is not complete these values are not used yet.
Enter a starting and ending vendor number, a starting and ending check date (usually the range for last year) and whether you want the check detail to print.

The system will read thru the vendor file, stopping at each vendor with "Y" in the "Independent Contractor" field. Then the payment history of every invoice for this vendor will be searched for payments made in the entered range. The total, and optionally the detail, will print on the report.

ClassInfo.ClassExplain: Booking air detail display and maintenance

ClassHelp.paragraph: Booking air information can be entered and changed here.

Enter a flight and departure date.
You can also set the cabin class and the rate type for the flight.
The system will automatically retrieve the flight rates and calculate a total for the passengers in this booking. Rate retrieval is programmed in the Flight Mainteance record=Air screen.

There are two buttons at the bottom of the screen for displaying the Flight pricing record=AirPricing images/tour/buttons/Price.gif and Flight inventory record=Inventory images/tour/buttons/Inventory.gif from the internal system.
Several fields are used in all Booking Detail record=BookingDetail screens.

The state of the four status fields depends of the information available. Once enough information is available, the system attempts to retieve the information required for the status. If any of the dependent fields change, the system automatically re-retrieves the new information and updates the status.
Booking hotel information can be entered and changed here.

Enter a hotel, check in date, and the number of nights.
You can also set the room class and the rate type for the hotel.
On the right side of the screen you can select the meals that the hotel should supply. There are fields for the number of meals and the day the meal should be served (where day 0 is the check-in date).
The system will automatically retrieve the hotel rates and calculate a total for the passengers in this booking. Rate retrieval is programmed in the Hotel Mainteance record=Hotel screen.

There are three buttons at the bottom of the screen for displaying the Room pricing record=HotelPricing images/tour/buttons/Price.gif , Meal pricing record=HotelMealPricing images/tour/buttons/Meal.gif , and Room inventory record=Inventory images/tour/buttons/Inventory.gif from the internal system.
Several fields are used in all Booking Detail record=BookingDetail screens.

The state of the four status fields depends of the information available. Once enough information is available, the system attempts to retieve the information required for the status. If any of the dependent fields change, the system automatically re-retrieves the new information and updates the status.
This report filters out tickets by several criteria for analysis.
Ticket transactions are very similar to A/P transactions with a few extra transactions to deal with.

When a tour is finalized, the transaction is similar to a normal A/P transaction. Typically, a ticket is confirmed upon finalization.
11/15/07 (Departure date)
Cost of Air 845.22
Prepaid ticket - Air - Estimate 845.22
Finalization - reserve ticket - Similar to a normal A/P transaction

When the ticket is actually issued to the individual passengers, the transaction is similar to a transaction for an A/P invoice:
10/31/07
Prepaid ticket - Air - Estimate 845.22
Accounts Payable - Air 845.22
Issue ticket.

If the ARC is used to clear tickets, a transaction is posted to reflect the transfer of the liabilty to ARC:
11/2/07
Accounts Payable - Air 845.22
Accounts Payable - ARC 845.22
ARC Report transmission

When you actually pay the ARC (by bank transfer), just clear out the ARC liability:
11/4/90
Accounts Payable - ARC 845.22
Cash 845.22
Pay ARC
Note: The dates are not in order here. The first transaction is posted last (at the departure date). This leaves a prepaid ticket asset on the books between the issue date and the departure date.
Tickets which have been changed or cancelled are also included on this report. The resulting G/L transactions is similar to the transaction for tickets.

Note: Although air purchased with a credit card is more likely to be paid for with an MCO, it is possible for the credit portion of the ticket to be validated by a wholesaler. For example, in the previous example, The ticket face value (with taxes) was 1075.00, leaving $75.00 of commissions to be collected from the ARC. The $1075 was colected directly from the customer by using the credit form on the ticket. The Issue transaction would be the same:
The ARC transaction would be:
Because there would be no cash payment, a debit memo must be entered into A/R, with the distribution reducing the receivable to the ARC:
In any case, the ARC Receivable account is only a control account, all transactions will eventually zero out this account.

Note: If you change the ARC summary account be careful try to do it before you do the A/R posting. It is possible to post issued tickets until the end of a period (with the original ARC acct), then change the ARC acct and run the ARC report with the new ARC number. All transactions after the end of the period would have the new ARC A/R acct. You would then use the ticket tranaction review report to set up the distribution for the ARC payment.

The system prints information on all the invoices, credit invoices, credit memos, prepayment requests, and departure estimates for this tour.

The Tour event action scheduler specifies the operation parameters for a tour.

For this tour class, specify what actions to execute automatically when an event record=TourEvent Help occurs. You simply enter the event to trigger on, the action to execute, and whether this task should be executed for all tour classes that are based on this class, or only tours that specify this tour class directly.
Tour events are triggers that occur during the life of a booking and tour.

Booking or Tour - There are booking events and tour events. Booking events are connected to the customer (such as money received) and Tour events are related to the tour (such as ordering components).

Event Type - There are events that occur when a booking changes (such as a booking deposit received or notification that all components have been confirmed), and there are events that occur on a specific date. These event are run using the Tour Event Scheduler record=TourEventSchedule Form .

You can modify your booking using the following sub-screens:

ClassInfo.ClassDesc: On selection, fake tour cd chg

ClassHelp.paragraph: Add and maintain Tour Headers.

A Tour Header is a template for a booking. When a user selects a Tour Header to use for a booking, the booking is populated with preferences for tour components (Such as preferred hotel room class) as well as individual tour components (ie., sightseeing, hotels).
There are several types of tour headers:

item-list.item:
A Booking Tour Header - This kind of tour header is typically used as a template for booking tours.
It supplies the booking with parameters for adding components and for pricing the tour.
There are two main types of booking headers:
Series Tour Header - This type of tour header has individual departures accessible through the (Series) Tours record=TourHeader images/tour/buttons/Tour.gif button.
Flexible Tour Header - A template for building tours

A Vendor module - This kind of module is only used to order a module from a vendor. Typically there are no detail components.
Cost is vendor supplied. (Make sure you enter the product COST in the tour pricing screen). Pricing can use any strategy.
A Planned module - This module type usually contains pricing and detail components. Individual components are ordered directly from vendors.

A Component package - This module type is used only as a template to supply customized components to a booking.
Costs come directly from the components.
Pricing is usually a markup from the component costs or from component pricing.

ClassHelp.paragraph: A Tour Header contains an information screen and several detail screens.
The initial message status and message transport fields are explained in the general Product record=Product Help help.

The information screen contains basic information such as the Tour type record=TourType Help ,
Product Category record=ProductCategory Help ,
Tour Class record=TourClass Help ,
Brochure record=Brochure Help , and
Initial Product Status record=ProductStatus Help .
Note: For tour headers, the Product Status is only relevant for Modular Tours. This will be the initial Booking Detail Product Status for the Module.
There are also several detail screens:

item-list.item: Options record=TourHeaderOption images/tour/buttons/Options.gif - Main screen for setting up the individual tour detail components
Inventory Detail record=Inventory images/tour/buttons/Inventory.gif - Tour header inventory maintenance
(Series) Tours record=TourHeader images/tour/buttons/Tour.gif - Individial tour departure maintenance (for Series Tours)
