The booking entry screen allows you to create and modify a booking.
You can modify your booking using the following sub-screens:
Maintain the Tour Header Hotel detail.
The only fields that are required are:

item-list.item: Day - The day (where day 1 is the tour departure date).
Product - The hotel to add to the booking

ClassHelp.paragraph: The other fields that are left blank are set to the default value for the booking.
Note: A description of the general fields exists in the Tour Header Detail screen record=TourHeaderDetail .
Note: This information is added to the Booking Hotel Detail Screen record=BookingHotel
Maintain the Tour Header Land detail.
The only fields that are required are:

item-list.item: Day - The day (where day 1 is the tour departure date).
Product - The Land to add to the booking

ClassHelp.paragraph: The other fields that are left blank are set to the default value for the booking.
Note: A description of the general fields exists in the Tour Header Detail screen record=TourHeaderDetail .
Note: This information is added to the Booking Land Detail Screen record=BookingLand
Maintain the Tour Header Pricing Line Item detail.
All the fields on this screen are optional:

item-list.item: Room Type - Add this item for each passenger in this room type.
Seq. number - An optional sequence number that determines the order the items will display in the booking
Fully Comm? - Check this to make this item fully commissionable
Comm. Rate - If this item is not fully commissionable, this is the commission rate to use
Payment due at - This item is due at the Final payment date or the deposit due date.
Cost - Optional cost to use for accounting

ClassHelp.paragraph: Note: A description of the general fields exists in the Tour Header Detail screen record=TourHeaderDetail .
Note: These items are added to the Booking Line Item Screen record=BookingLine

A Tour Header Option is a collection of tour components that can be added to a booking. The components will only be added if the criteria for the option are met, either automatically (For example, a weekend surcharge selected based on the day of the week) or manually (such as a hotel upgrade).
These are the detail screens where individual tour components are entered:

item-list.item: Option record=TourHeaderOption Grid - Options can be nested within other options to create a hierarchy of options.
Pricing detail record=TourHeaderLine images/tour/buttons/Price.gif - Booking Pricing Line items
Tour (header detail) record=TourHeaderTour images/tour/buttons/Tour.gif - Detail Modular Tours to add to this tour
Air Header record=TourHeaderAirHeader images/tour/buttons/AirHeader.gif - Air reservations grouping (ie., Whom the Ticket was ordered from)
Air record=TourHeaderAir images/tour/buttons/Air.gif - Individual air segments
Land record=TourHeaderLand images/tour/buttons/Land.gif - Transfers, sightseeing, itinerary paragraphs
Car record=TourHeaderCar images/tour/buttons/Car.gif - Rental cars
Transportation record=TourHeaderTransportation images/tour/buttons/Transportation.gif - Rail, ferry, etc.
Item record=TourHeaderItem images/tour/buttons/Item.gif - Non-tour related items

ClassHelp.paragraph: In each detail screen, there are two fields that determine how the detail item is added to the booking:

item-list.item: The mod code tells the booking whether to add, delete, or replace the detail item.
The mod item tells the booking which previously entered detail item needs to be deleted for "delete" or changed for "modify" detail items.

ClassHelp.paragraph: Note: Typically if you want to change a product you will use delete to delete the detail product and then add to add the new item. replace will take the current item and change only the fields that are set. This can be advantagous if you want to change the number of nights for a hotel without changing the meal, rate, and class. replace will not work well if you want to change the hotel, as the default rate, class, etc will be transfered from the replaced hotel.
The tour header option screen has several fields which are used at the time of booking to determine if the option detail should be added:

item-list.item: Ask for answer - This option is a question that will be asked at the time of booking. The option detail items are all the possible answers to this question. This question may be answered in the Booking Option Screen record=BookingAnswer .
Always Resolve - This question must be answered by the user (ie., pick a car class). If this box is not checked, the user may or may not answer this question.
Pax class - Only add these option components for passengers in this class of room (All means add this for each passenger)
Sequence (Optional) - Places the items in order on the screen.

ClassHelp.paragraph:
Example 1: You want to use hotel A for Jan-Jul and hotel B for Aug-Sep.
To do is: Enter a tour header option "question": Which hotel?
Then enter two tour header option "answers" that have the date ranges for each hotel. Then go to the hotel screen for each of these and enter the correct hotel.
When the booking is made the system will automatically include the correct hotel depending on the tour departure date.

Example 2: To enter an air-surcharge for December,
Enter a tour header option titled: December Air surcharge with a date range of Dec 01-Dec 31.
Then, enter an additional line item and a modified ticket in the line item and header header detail screens.
The surcharge (entered in pricing) and modified ticket (entered in ticket entry) will automatically be added to a booking departing in December.

Example 3: Say you want to give the client the chance to upgrade their hotel in Tokyo. Enter a tour header option "question": Upgrade to Palace hotel?
Then enter two tour header option "answers": (Yes and No). (You could also enter date ranges if it was only available for a certain amount of time) Then you would go to hotel display for option 1(Yes) and delete the normal hotel (mod delete) and re-enter the upgraded hotel, then go to tour pricing and add an item, "Hotel upgrade surcharge" with the surcharge amount.

ClassHelp.paragraph: This program is used to package invoices, prepayments requests, and credit memos for payment. This program offers an easy way to select a batch of invoices for the check request program.

First, enter the vendor code. The system displays the current balance of selected invoices and a list of all of the invoices (whether they are selected or not) and prepayments, and the amount selected for payment on each invoice. They will be in the order of the starting service dates.

If you select an item on the screen, first the system will display the tour number and description, then the system will ask you to enter an amount to pay (defaults to the full invoice amount). If you enter zero, this invoice is de-selected for payment. For prepayment requests you must enter either the amount requested or zero, partial prepayments are not accepted. Credit invoices must also be selected-in full.
If you type "All" at the Any change prompt, then all the invoices on the screen are selected for full payment.

Note: To see the resulting G/L entries, take a look at the check printing program. This program has no effect on any balances.
Check printing ?screen=PrintCheckJournal Form
is where the data is updated.

ClassHelp.paragraph: The version is alternate postings for different versions of the Financial Statements.
For example, Financial, Federal, and State depreciation are typically different.
The transaction type file contains the information all the sub-systems need to post a transaction to the General Ledger. Usually, this files does not need to be modified.
The transaction type files has a hierarchy of information about each transaction:

item-list.item: System - Subsystem that the transaction came from. (A/P, A/R, etc.)
Transaction - The transaction class. (Typically ties directly to a transaction source file) (Such as a Bank Trx or an Asset Transaction)
Transaction Status - The current transaction status. (Typically tied to the source transaction) (Such as a A/P Prepayment or Distributed A/P Prepayment)
Transaction Header - Description of the specific G/L transaction. (ie., Vendor Invoice)
Transaction Type - Description of the specific G/L transaction. (ie., Credit A/P Cash or Debit A/P Prepaid tours)

ClassHelp.paragraph: For example: Say an invoice is received from a non-tour vendor:

item-list.item: This transaction goes into the Accounts Payable System.
The Transaction is an Accounts Payable Detail Transaction.
The Transaction status is a Manual Invoice. When the check is printed, this status will change to a Paid Manual Invoice.
The G/L Transaction Header is a Manual Invoice.

item.paragraph: There are two Transaction Types involved and they are processed by the General Ledger like this:

ClassHelp.paragraph: Note: The fields that may not have an obvious use are:

item-list.item: In Transaction Status - A Transaction that is not active should not change status any more (ie., Paid Invoices).
In Transaction Types - The source status is the status of the source for this type of transaction.
In Transaction Types - The Type Code is user defined (Trx is the base transaction, Dist is the distribution side, Diff is the differential, etc...).

In Transaction Types - The Type Code is user defined (Trx is the base transaction, Dist is the distribution side, Diff is the differential, etc...).

ClassHelp.paragraph: The transaction type file contains the information all the sub-systems need to post a transaction to the General Ledger. Usually, this files does not need to be modified.
The transaction type files has a hierarchy of information about each transaction:

item-list.item: System - Subsystem that the transaction came from. (A/P, A/R, etc.)
Transaction - The transaction class. (Typically ties directly to a transaction source file) (Such as a Bank Trx or an Asset Transaction)
Transaction Status - The current transaction status. (Typically tied to the source transaction) (Such as a A/P Prepayment or Distributed A/P Prepayment)
Transaction Header - Description of the specific G/L transaction. (ie., Vendor Invoice)
Transaction Type - Description of the specific G/L transaction. (ie., Credit A/P Cash or Debit A/P Prepaid tours)

ClassHelp.paragraph: For example: Say an invoice is received from a non-tour vendor:

item-list.item: This transaction goes into the Accounts Payable System.
The Transaction is an Accounts Payable Detail Transaction.
The Transaction status is a Manual Invoice. When the check is printed, this status will change to a Paid Manual Invoice.
The G/L Transaction Header is a Manual Invoice.

item.paragraph: There are two Transaction Types involved and they are processed by the General Ledger like this:

ClassHelp.paragraph: This table contains some canned description formats for the financial statments.

This table is used to make Financial Statment Formatting easier by giving users a choice of canned formats. The formats are user defined as they are just passed as-is to the Financial Statment XML parser. Typically, you will enter the actual XSL-FO formatting commands such as "text-decoration: underline" which can be used directly by XSL.
There are several canned formats:

item-list.item: Underline
Bold
Large Text
Centered Text

(Check) number (optional)

Account for the G/L distribution. You may also click on the
Detail record=BankTrxBatchDist Detail button to split the distribution between several G/L accounts.
Note: If you don't specify a G/L account the amount will be distributed to the default account in the
Asset Debt Control Form record=AssetDrControl file.

ClassHelp.paragraph: After entering the transactions, you may add them to the bank account detail by pressing the post button. If you confirm the batch in the posting screen, the transactions will be added to the checking detail file and also be posted to the General Ledger.
Note: To enter a void check, just enter a check with an amount of zero and a payee of VOID. This will not create any entries, but will maintain the complete list of check numbers for the audit trail.

This program is used to enter all incoming checks for bookings (both deposits and final payments).
Program Operation:
Usually this program is easy to operate because the payment is returned with the confirmation payment stub. The stub has the booking number printed on it, making receipt entry very simple.

You can either enter the booking number if you know it, or you can press the
Lookup screen=BookingGridScreen Lookup
button to find the booking by the agency's ARC number.

To enter a non-tour related cash receipt or a payment to multiple bookings, press the
Distribution record=CashBatchDist Distribution
button. In the distribution screen, you can apply the check amount to bookings and/or general ledger accounts.

For each check received, you may also enter the check number, and ABA number (If deposit slips are printed). The check amount defaults to the deposit amount for the initial payment and the outstanding balance for subsequent payments.
Once a deposit is posted, the booking's internal status is changed to "Accepted" and the A/R detail is set-up.
The A/R account that is credited is the one that is listed in the booking record. The A/R account in the booking record comes from the tour header.
For example, the G/L entry for a batch of checks for two bookings and a purchase rebate:

ClassHelp.paragraph: This screen displays all the transactions in the original posting.

You can display the original General Ledger transaction by pressing the
Transaction Transaction record=AcctDetail
button.

You can display the source transaction by pressing the
Source Source
button. The screen displayed depends on the type of transaction.
You can access an MCO either by the booking number, or the actual MCO number. Entering the first numbers of the MCO number will display all matching MCOs in order.
If there are more than one MCOs for one booking, then they will all display.
If the MCO has not been posted to the General Ledger yet, the amounts may be changed. The amounts may only be changed for report use, the actual amount posted to the booking may not be changed.

If the amount posted to a booking is incorrect, first change the MCO information to the correct values, so the MCO submission will be correct, then enter a credit or debit memo to the booking with distribution to the MCO variance account. This will insure all entries are correct.
For example:
MCO net should have been $900, but was posted as $1000.
First, change the MCO amount to 1000. Then enter a debit memo for $100. The booking will show the correct amount. If the carrier pays $1000, the G/L entries will be:
The debit memo will produce:
leaving all accounts in the correct state.

ClassHelp.paragraph: The transaction type file contains the information all the sub-systems need to post a transaction to the General Ledger. Usually, this files does not need to be modified.
The transaction type files has a hierarchy of information about each transaction:

item-list.item: System - Subsystem that the transaction came from. (A/P, A/R, etc.)
Transaction - The transaction class. (Typically ties directly to a transaction source file) (Such as a Bank Trx or an Asset Transaction)
Transaction Status - The current transaction status. (Typically tied to the source transaction) (Such as a A/P Prepayment or Distributed A/P Prepayment)
Transaction Header - Description of the specific G/L transaction. (ie., Vendor Invoice)
Transaction Type - Description of the specific G/L transaction. (ie., Credit A/P Cash or Debit A/P Prepaid tours)

ClassHelp.paragraph: For example: Say an invoice is received from a non-tour vendor:

item-list.item: This transaction goes into the Accounts Payable System.
The Transaction is an Accounts Payable Detail Transaction.
The Transaction status is a Manual Invoice. When the check is printed, this status will change to a Paid Manual Invoice.
The G/L Transaction Header is a Manual Invoice.

item.paragraph: There are two Transaction Types involved and they are processed by the General Ledger like this:

ClassHelp.paragraph: Note: The fields that may not have an obvious use are:

item-list.item: In Transaction Status - A Transaction that is not active should not change status any more (ie., Paid Invoices).
In Transaction Types - The source status is the status of the source for this type of transaction.
In Transaction Types - The Type Code is user defined (Trx is the base transaction, Dist is the distribution side, Diff is the differential, etc...).

ClassHelp.paragraph: The Account Transaction Distribution displays the source of a G/L Transaction.
This is the audit trail back to the originating transactions.

To display the all of the transaction distribution for this transaction, click on the
Detail Detail record=AcctDetailDist
button.
You would only press this button if you are in the maintenance screen to see the rest of the distribution for this transaction. Pressing this from the grid screen will redisplay the same data.

To display the distribution group, click on the
Group Group screen=AcctDetailDistGroupGridScreen
button. The distribution group is the complete original source transaction.

To display the source transaction, click on the
Source trx Source
button. The screen displayed will depend on the source of the transaction. (ie., For a cash deposit, the original Bank Transaction will display)

Often you will see a
Transaction record=AcctDetail Transaction
button. This button will display the top-level G/L posting transaction.

ClassHelp.paragraph: Use this screen to setup, change, and close inventory for a product.

An inventory can be allocated for each day, rate, class, and other attribute for each product. If the rate, class, and/or other attribute are blank, the inventory will be allocated to any category in the blank category.
The Oversell amount allows the product to be sold beyond the alloted inventory. This oversell amount should be reduced as the inventory date draws near.
Closing a date will prevent further sales regardless of the availability.

To add, change, or delete a block of dates at once, press the Range adjustment images/tour/buttons/Inventory.gif record=Inventory button. From this screen, you may enter a date range and new values. Any fields left blank will be unchanged in the range. To delete a range, click the delete checkbox. Press the Adjust range images/tour/buttons/Inventory.gif record=Inventory to make the adjustments.

ClassInfo.ClassDesc: A travel product that takes you from one location to another.

ClassHelp.paragraph: Add and maintain Tour Headers.

A Tour Header is a template for a booking. When a user selects a Tour Header to use for a booking, the booking is populated with preferences for tour components (Such as preferred hotel room class) as well as individual tour components (ie., sightseeing, hotels).
There are several types of tour headers:

item-list.item:
A Booking Tour Header - This kind of tour header is typically used as a template for booking tours.
It supplies the booking with parameters for adding components and for pricing the tour.
There are two main types of booking headers:
Series Tour Header - This type of tour header has individual departures accessible through the (Series) Tours record=TourHeader images/tour/buttons/Tour.gif button.
Flexible Tour Header - A template for building tours

A Vendor module - This kind of module is only used to order a module from a vendor. Typically there are no detail components.
Cost is vendor supplied. (Make sure you enter the product COST in the tour pricing screen). Pricing can use any strategy.
A Planned module - This module type usually contains pricing and detail components. Individual components are ordered directly from vendors.

A Component package - This module type is used only as a template to supply customized components to a booking.
Costs come directly from the components.
Pricing is usually a markup from the component costs or from component pricing.

ClassHelp.paragraph: A Tour Header contains an information screen and several detail screens.
The initial message status and message transport fields are explained in the general Product record=Product Help help.

The information screen contains basic information such as the Tour type record=TourType Help ,
Product Category record=ProductCategory Help ,
Tour Class record=TourClass Help ,
Brochure record=Brochure Help , and
Initial Product Status record=ProductStatus Help .
Note: For tour headers, the Product Status is only relevant for Modular Tours. This will be the initial Booking Detail Product Status for the Module.
There are also several detail screens:

item-list.item: Options record=TourHeaderOption images/tour/buttons/Options.gif - Main screen for setting up the individual tour detail components
Inventory Detail record=Inventory images/tour/buttons/Inventory.gif - Tour header inventory maintenance
(Series) Tours record=TourHeader images/tour/buttons/Tour.gif - Individial tour departure maintenance (for Series Tours)

ClassHelp.paragraph: Use this screen to setup, change, and close inventory for a product.

An inventory can be allocated for each day, rate, class, and other attribute for each product. If the rate, class, and/or other attribute are blank, the inventory will be allocated to any category in the blank category.
The Oversell amount allows the product to be sold beyond the alloted inventory. This oversell amount should be reduced as the inventory date draws near.
Closing a date will prevent further sales regardless of the availability.

To add, change, or delete a block of dates at once, press the Range adjustment images/tour/buttons/Inventory.gif record=Inventory button. From this screen, you may enter a date range and new values. Any fields left blank will be unchanged in the range. To delete a range, click the delete checkbox. Press the Adjust range images/tour/buttons/Inventory.gif record=Inventory to make the adjustments.

A Tour Header Option is a collection of tour components that can be added to a booking. The components will only be added if the criteria for the option are met, either automatically (For example, a weekend surcharge selected based on the day of the week) or manually (such as a hotel upgrade).
These are the detail screens where individual tour components are entered:

item-list.item: Option record=TourHeaderOption Grid - Options can be nested within other options to create a hierarchy of options.
Pricing detail record=TourHeaderLine images/tour/buttons/Price.gif - Booking Pricing Line items
Tour (header detail) record=TourHeaderTour images/tour/buttons/Tour.gif - Detail Modular Tours to add to this tour
Air Header record=TourHeaderAirHeader images/tour/buttons/AirHeader.gif - Air reservations grouping (ie., Whom the Ticket was ordered from)
Air record=TourHeaderAir images/tour/buttons/Air.gif - Individual air segments
Land record=TourHeaderLand images/tour/buttons/Land.gif - Transfers, sightseeing, itinerary paragraphs
Car record=TourHeaderCar images/tour/buttons/Car.gif - Rental cars
Transportation record=TourHeaderTransportation images/tour/buttons/Transportation.gif - Rail, ferry, etc.
Item record=TourHeaderItem images/tour/buttons/Item.gif - Non-tour related items

ClassHelp.paragraph: In each detail screen, there are two fields that determine how the detail item is added to the booking:

item-list.item: The mod code tells the booking whether to add, delete, or replace the detail item.
The mod item tells the booking which previously entered detail item needs to be deleted for "delete" or changed for "modify" detail items.

ClassHelp.paragraph: Note: Typically if you want to change a product you will use delete to delete the detail product and then add to add the new item. replace will take the current item and change only the fields that are set. This can be advantagous if you want to change the number of nights for a hotel without changing the meal, rate, and class. replace will not work well if you want to change the hotel, as the default rate, class, etc will be transfered from the replaced hotel.
The tour header option screen has several fields which are used at the time of booking to determine if the option detail should be added:

item-list.item: Ask for answer - This option is a question that will be asked at the time of booking. The option detail items are all the possible answers to this question. This question may be answered in the Booking Option Screen record=BookingAnswer .
Always Resolve - This question must be answered by the user (ie., pick a car class). If this box is not checked, the user may or may not answer this question.
Pax class - Only add these option components for passengers in this class of room (All means add this for each passenger)
Sequence (Optional) - Places the items in order on the screen.

ClassHelp.paragraph:
Example 1: You want to use hotel A for Jan-Jul and hotel B for Aug-Sep.
To do is: Enter a tour header option "question": Which hotel?
Then enter two tour header option "answers" that have the date ranges for each hotel. Then go to the hotel screen for each of these and enter the correct hotel.
When the booking is made the system will automatically include the correct hotel depending on the tour departure date.

Example 2: To enter an air-surcharge for December,
Enter a tour header option titled: December Air surcharge with a date range of Dec 01-Dec 31.
Then, enter an additional line item and a modified ticket in the line item and header header detail screens.
The surcharge (entered in pricing) and modified ticket (entered in ticket entry) will automatically be added to a booking departing in December.

Example 3: Say you want to give the client the chance to upgrade their hotel in Tokyo. Enter a tour header option "question": Upgrade to Palace hotel?
Then enter two tour header option "answers": (Yes and No). (You could also enter date ranges if it was only available for a certain amount of time) Then you would go to hotel display for option 1(Yes) and delete the normal hotel (mod delete) and re-enter the upgraded hotel, then go to tour pricing and add an item, "Hotel upgrade surcharge" with the surcharge amount.

A Tour Header Option is a collection of tour components that can be added to a booking. The components will only be added if the criteria for the option are met, either automatically (For example, a weekend surcharge selected based on the day of the week) or manually (such as a hotel upgrade).
These are the detail screens where individual tour components are entered:

item-list.item: Option record=TourHeaderOption Grid - Options can be nested within other options to create a hierarchy of options.
Pricing detail record=TourHeaderLine images/tour/buttons/Price.gif - Booking Pricing Line items
Tour (header detail) record=TourHeaderTour images/tour/buttons/Tour.gif - Detail Modular Tours to add to this tour
Air Header record=TourHeaderAirHeader images/tour/buttons/AirHeader.gif - Air reservations grouping (ie., Whom the Ticket was ordered from)
Air record=TourHeaderAir images/tour/buttons/Air.gif - Individual air segments
Land record=TourHeaderLand images/tour/buttons/Land.gif - Transfers, sightseeing, itinerary paragraphs
Car record=TourHeaderCar images/tour/buttons/Car.gif - Rental cars
Transportation record=TourHeaderTransportation images/tour/buttons/Transportation.gif - Rail, ferry, etc.
Item record=TourHeaderItem images/tour/buttons/Item.gif - Non-tour related items

ClassHelp.paragraph: In each detail screen, there are two fields that determine how the detail item is added to the booking:

item-list.item: The mod code tells the booking whether to add, delete, or replace the detail item.
The mod item tells the booking which previously entered detail item needs to be deleted for "delete" or changed for "modify" detail items.

ClassHelp.paragraph: Note: Typically if you want to change a product you will use delete to delete the detail product and then add to add the new item. replace will take the current item and change only the fields that are set. This can be advantagous if you want to change the number of nights for a hotel without changing the meal, rate, and class. replace will not work well if you want to change the hotel, as the default rate, class, etc will be transfered from the replaced hotel.
The tour header option screen has several fields which are used at the time of booking to determine if the option detail should be added:

item-list.item: Ask for answer - This option is a question that will be asked at the time of booking. The option detail items are all the possible answers to this question. This question may be answered in the Booking Option Screen record=BookingAnswer .
Always Resolve - This question must be answered by the user (ie., pick a car class). If this box is not checked, the user may or may not answer this question.
Pax class - Only add these option components for passengers in this class of room (All means add this for each passenger)
Sequence (Optional) - Places the items in order on the screen.

ClassHelp.paragraph:
Example 1: You want to use hotel A for Jan-Jul and hotel B for Aug-Sep.
To do is: Enter a tour header option "question": Which hotel?
Then enter two tour header option "answers" that have the date ranges for each hotel. Then go to the hotel screen for each of these and enter the correct hotel.
When the booking is made the system will automatically include the correct hotel depending on the tour departure date.

Example 2: To enter an air-surcharge for December,
Enter a tour header option titled: December Air surcharge with a date range of Dec 01-Dec 31.
Then, enter an additional line item and a modified ticket in the line item and header header detail screens.
The surcharge (entered in pricing) and modified ticket (entered in ticket entry) will automatically be added to a booking departing in December.

Example 3: Say you want to give the client the chance to upgrade their hotel in Tokyo. Enter a tour header option "question": Upgrade to Palace hotel?
Then enter two tour header option "answers": (Yes and No). (You could also enter date ranges if it was only available for a certain amount of time) Then you would go to hotel display for option 1(Yes) and delete the normal hotel (mod delete) and re-enter the upgraded hotel, then go to tour pricing and add an item, "Hotel upgrade surcharge" with the surcharge amount.

Comm. Rate - If this item is not fully commissionable, this is the commission rate to use
Payment due at - This item is due at the Final payment date or the deposit due date.
Cost - Optional cost to use for accounting

There are two buttons at the bottom of the screen for displaying the Car pricing record=CarPricing images/tour/buttons/Price.gif and Car inventory record=Inventory images/tour/buttons/Inventory.gif from the internal system.
Several fields are used in all Booking Detail record=BookingDetail Grid screens.

The state of the four status fields depends of the information available. Once enough information is available, the system attempts to retieve the information required for the status. You also have the option of selecting different itinerary formats by typing in a stylesheet name.
You may also send the itinerary by selecting the action target and clicking the send button.

item-list.item: Day - The day (where day 1 is the tour departure date).

Note: This information is added to the Booking Tour Detail Screen record=BookingTour
General information that applies to all the tour header detail screens:
There are several message transport fields that determine how information is retrieved from this vendor:

item-list.item: Information - General information such as Product name, etc.
Inventory - Product availability
Cost - Product cost
Ordering - Book the product

ClassHelp.paragraph: Note: Leave these fields blank to have the system determine the best way to get the requested information.

The From Block item specifies that the product is to be taken from the internal Inventory when it is booked.
The Tour order item says that a tour order should be automatically sent when the booking status changes to Okay.
The wait for ack item specifies the days to wait for acknowledgement of a tour order before being flagged in the tour order review screen.
The initial status field is the initial product status of this item when it is added to a booking.
The Mod Code determines what to do with this item when it is selected for a new booking:

item-list.item: Add - Add this detail item to the booking
Replace - Replace this item with the item specified in Replace Item
Delete - Delete the item specified in Replace Item

ClassHelp.paragraph: The Replace Item is the detail item that will be deleted or replaced. You must use the lookup button to find the item in the Tour Header Detail record=TourHeader screen.

The booking option selection screen is used to select Tour Options. The tour options selected will add tour components to a booking. The components will only be added if the criteria for the option are met, either automatically (For example, a weekend surcharge selected based on the day of the week) or manually (such as a hotel upgrade).

ClassInfo.ClassDesc: When a new booking answer gets selected, add the tour header detail to the booking.

This screen is used to display and change the booking pricing.

Pricing line items are added automatically as products are added to the booking. Any item that you add or change will have a pricing status of 'Manual', meaning the the price will not change automatically when the product is changed.

The system will automatically retrieve the flight rates and calculate a total for the passengers in this booking. Rate retrieval is programmed in the Flight Mainteance record=Air screen.

There are two buttons at the bottom of the screen for displaying the Flight pricing record=AirPricing images/tour/buttons/Price.gif and Flight inventory record=Inventory images/tour/buttons/Inventory.gif from the internal system.
Several fields are used in all Booking Detail record=BookingDetail screens.

The state of the four status fields depends of the information available. Once enough information is available, the system attempts to retieve the information required for the status. If any of the dependent fields change, the system automatically re-retrieves the new information and updates the status.

Booking hotel information can be entered and changed here.

Enter a hotel, check in date, and the number of nights.
You can also set the room class and the rate type for the hotel.
On the right side of the screen you can select the meals that the hotel should supply. There are fields for the number of meals and the day the meal should be served (where day 0 is the check-in date).
The system will automatically retrieve the hotel rates and calculate a total for the passengers in this booking. Rate retrieval is programmed in the Hotel Mainteance record=Hotel screen.

ClassHelp.paragraph: Enter the rate classes to used for this product.
Use this screen to setup, change, and close inventory for a product.

An inventory can be allocated for each day, rate, class, and other attribute for each product. If the rate, class, and/or other attribute are blank, the inventory will be allocated to any category in the blank category.
The Oversell amount allows the product to be sold beyond the alloted inventory. This oversell amount should be reduced as the inventory date draws near.
Closing a date will prevent further sales regardless of the availability.

To add, change, or delete a block of dates at once, press the Range adjustment images/tour/buttons/Inventory.gif record=Inventory button. From this screen, you may enter a date range and new values. Any fields left blank will be unchanged in the range. To delete a range, click the delete checkbox. Press the Adjust range images/tour/buttons/Inventory.gif record=Inventory to make the adjustments.

ClassHelp.paragraph: The booking option selection screen is used to select Tour Options. The tour options selected will add tour components to a booking.
